articles.title: About Me
articles.contents: I’m a Learning Engineer for an ed tech company and a PhD student in educational psychology studying representations for learning. I’m interested in educational technology, cognitive science, learning analytics, and STEM education.

articles.title: Kaleb Mathieu
articles.contents:
Kaleb Mathieu
          
          
          Home
          About
          Projects
          ☰
          
          
      
        
          
            Kaleb Mathieu
          
          
            
              
              About
              I’m a PhD student in educational psychology and a Data Coach at InnovateEDU, where I work with our partner schools to support implementation of Landing Zone, build dashboards and data visuals, and provide ongoing professional development on all things data related. My current research explores the use of representations for learning chemistry.
              
              
              Research interests
              Educational technology | STEM education | Learning sciences
              Cognitive science | R | Data science | Statistics

articles.title: Projects
articles.contents:
Research
Registration for study - The Role of Instructional Representation in Learning Chemical Diagrams
Data Visualizations
Survey Data Dashboard Prototype
Publications
Anker, M., Balasanthiran, C., Balasanthiran, V., Chisholm, M. H., Jayaraj, S., Mathieu, K., … Simonsick, W. J. (2017). A new route for the preparation of enriched iso-polylactide from rac-lactide via a Lewis acid catalyzed ring-opening of an epoxide. Dalton Transactions, 46(18), 5938–5945. doi:10.1039/c6dt03198f
Miscellaneous
This Augmented reality model of a molecule with rotating bonds was created with Blender for 3D rendering and processing, Avogadro for 3D molecule modeling, and Reality Composer for creation of the AR.
